console.containers.freq-plans-select.ind: Do not set a frequency plan
console.views.device-add.manual.configur: ABP and multicast activation mode selection unavailable
console.views.device-add.repository.devi: Register another end device of this type

lib.field-description-messages.freqPlanD: A Frequency Plan defines data rates and channels which comply with the LoRaWAN Regional Parameters for a band or geographical area.
lib.field-description-messages.freqPlanL: You need to choose a Frequency Plan which adheres to the local regulations of where your end device is located. It is also important that the gateways in reach of this end device use the same Frequency Plan.
lib.field-description-messages.devEuiDes: A 64 bit extended unique identifier for your end device.
lib.field-description-messages.devEuiLoc: It should be provided to you by the manufacturer, or printed on the end device packaging.
lib.field-description-messages.devEuiAbs: Contact the manufacturer or your reseller.
lib.field-description-messages.joinEuiDe: The JoinEUI (formerly called AppEUI) is a 64 bit extended unique identifier used to identify the Join Server during activation.
lib.field-description-messages.joinEuiLo: It should be provided by the end device manufacturer for pre-provisioned end devices, or by the owner of the Join Server you will use.
lib.field-description-messages.joinEuiAb: Contact the manufacturer or your reseller. If they can not provide a JoinEUI, and your end device is programmable, it is okay to use all-zeros, but ensure that you use the same JoinEUI in your device as you enter in The Things Stack.
lib.field-description-messages.appKeyDes: An end device specific encryption key used during OTAA to derive the AppSKey (in LoRaWAN 1.1x) or both the NwkSKey and AppSKey in LoRaWAN 1.0x.
lib.field-description-messages.appKeyLoc: It is usually pre-provisioned by the end device manufacturer, but can also be created by the user.
lib.field-description-messages.appKeyAbs: Contact the manufacturer or your reseller. If they cannot provide an AppKey, and your end device is programmable, it is okay to generate one.
lib.field-description-messages.nwkKeyDes: A device specific encryption key used to derive the FNwkSIntKey, SNwkSIntKey, NwkSEncKey in LoRaWAN 1.1. When a LoRaWAN 1.1 capable device connects to a LoRaWAN 1.0x Network Server which does not support dual root keys (NwkKey and AppKey), the NwkKey value is used as the AppKey value.
lib.field-description-messages.nwkKeyLoc: It is usually pre-provisioned by the end device manufacturer, but some end devices also allow using a user-defined value.
lib.field-description-messages.nwkKeyAbs: Contact the manufacturer or your reseller. If they cannot provide an AppKey, and your end device is programmable, it is okay to generate one.
lib.field-description-messages.devIdDesc: A unique, human-readable identifier for your end device.
lib.field-description-messages.devIdLoca: You can make it up, so be creative. End device IDs can not be reused by multiple end devices within the same application.
lib.field-description-messages.joinServe: The Join Server's role is to store root keys, generate session keys, and to send those securely to the Network Server and Application Server of choice. The device contains the same root keys, which can be provisioned as part of assembly, distribution or upon installation.

Contact your manufacturer or reseller to find out if your end device is pre-provisioned on an external Join Server. If not, you may use the local Join Server, or provision the end device on our Global Join Server so that you can transfer it without lock-in.
If the end device is pre-provisioned, you will need the keys from the manufacturer to activate it.
lib.field-description-messages.devAddrDe: A 32 bit non-unique identifier, assigned by the Network Server during end device activation.
lib.field-description-messages.devAddrLo: For Activation-By-Personalization (ABP), you must generate a device address and manually program it into the end device. You can use the generate button next to the input field to generate a device address.
lib.field-description-messages.appSKeyDe: After activation, this encryption key is used to secure messages which carry a payload.
lib.field-description-messages.appSKeyLo: For Activation-By-Personalization (ABP), you must generate a key and manually program it into your end device. You can use the generate button next to the input field to generate a key.
lib.field-description-messages.nwkSKeyDe: After activation, this encryption key is used to secure messages which do not carry a payload.
lib.field-description-messages.nwkSKeyLo: For OTAA, it is created by the Network Server. If using ABP, you must create one and manually enter it in the end device and The Things Stack.
lib.field-description-messages.lwVersion: The LoRa Alliance LoRaWAN specification your end device conforms to, which defines which Media Access Control (MAC) features it supports.
The LoRaWAN version for your end device should be provided by the manufacturer in a datasheet as LoRaWAN version or LoRaWAN specification
Contact your manufacturer or reseller, since specifying the wrong version can lead to complex issues when the Network Server provides the end device with unsupported configuration (MAC) commands.
lib.field-description-messages.regParame: The Regional Parameters specify frequency, dwell time, and other communication settings for different geographical areas. The Regional Parameters version is the version of the LoRa Alliance specification which your device supports.
The Regional Parameters version should be provided by the end device manufacturer in a datasheet.

Contact your manufacturer or reseller to obtain the correct specification. Specifying a wrong version can lead to complex issues when the Network Server provides the end device with unsupported configuration (MAC) commands.
lib.field-description-messages.classDesc: The LoRaWAN specification defines three end device types. All LoRaWAN end devices must implement Class A, whereas Class B and Class C are extensions to the specification of Class A devices that specify different downlink reception behavior.
lib.field-description-messages.classLoca: The class capabilities of your end device should be provided by the manufaturer in a datasheet.
lib.field-description-messages.classAbse: If your end device will not receive downlink messages, you can safely use Class A, which all LoRaWAN certified devices must implement. Otherwise contact your manufacturer or reseller.
lib.field-description-messages.rx1DataRa: The Data Rate Offset sets the offset between the uplink data rate and the downlink data rate used to communicate with the End Device during the first reception slot (RX1).
lib.field-description-messages.dataRateI: The Data Rate Index specifies which data rate downlink communications will use, as given in the Regional Parameters.
lib.shared-messages.altitudeDesc: The altitude in meters, where 0 means sea level
lib.shared-messages.appEUIDescription: The AppEUI uniquely identifies the owner of the end device. If no AppEUI is provided by the device manufacturer (usually for development), it can be filled with zeros.
lib.shared-messages.asServerIDDescriptio: The AS-ID of the Application Server to use
lib.shared-messages.asServerKekLabelDesc: The KEK label of the Application Server to use for wrapping the application session key
lib.shared-messages.attributeDescription: Attributes can be used to set arbitrary information about the entity, to be used by scripts, or simply for your own organization
lib.shared-messages.attributeKeyValidate: Attribute keys must have at least 3 characters and contain no special characters
lib.shared-messages.attributesValidateRe: All attribute entry values are required. Please remove empty entries.
lib.shared-messages.collaboratorModalWar: Are you sure you want to remove {collaboratorId} as a collaborator?
lib.shared-messages.delayWarning: Delay too short. The lower bound ({minimumValue}ms) will be used by the Gateway Server.
lib.shared-messages.deviceDescDescriptio: Optional end device description; can also be used to save notes about the end device
lib.shared-messages.deviceDescPlaceholde: Description for my new end device
lib.shared-messages.enforceDutyCycleDesc: Recommended for all gateways in order to respect spectrum regulations
lib.shared-messages.frequencyPlanWarning: Without choosing a frequency plan, packets from the gateway will not be correctly processed
lib.shared-messages.gatewayDescDescripti: Optional gateway description; can also be used to save notes about the gateway
lib.shared-messages.gsServerAddressDescr: The address of the Gateway Server to connect to
lib.shared-messages.homeNetIDDescription: ID to identify the LoRaWAN network
lib.shared-messages.insufficientAppKeyRi: Insufficient rights to set an AppKey
lib.shared-messages.insufficientNwkKeyRi: Insufficient rights to set a NwkKey
lib.shared-messages.latitudeDesc: The north-south position in degrees, where 0 is the equator
lib.shared-messages.lbsLNSSecret: LoRa Basics Station LNS Authentication Key
lib.shared-messages.lbsLNSSecretDescript: The Authentication Key for Lora Basics Station LNS connections. This field is ignored for other gateways.
lib.shared-messages.longitudeDesc: The east-west position in degrees, where 0 is the prime meridian (Greenwich)
lib.shared-messages.lorawanPhyVersionDes: The LoRaWAN PHY version of the end device
lib.shared-messages.name: Name
lib.shared-messages.noDesc: This end device has no description
lib.shared-messages.nsEmptyDefault: Leave empty to link to the Network Server in the same cluster
lib.shared-messages.nsServerKekLabelDesc: The KEK label of the Network Server to use for wrapping the network session key
lib.shared-messages.payloadFormattersUpd: There was an error updating the payload formatter
lib.shared-messages.phyVersionDescriptio: The Regional Parameters version (PHY), as provided by the device manufacturer
lib.shared-messages.requireAuthenticated: Controls whether this gateway may only connect if it uses an authenticated Basic Station or MQTT connection
lib.shared-messages.resetWarning: Reseting is insecure and makes your end device susceptible for replay attacks
lib.shared-messages.scheduleDownlinkLate: Enable server-side buffer of downlink messages
lib.shared-messages.skipCryptoDescriptio: Skip decryption of uplink payloads and encryption of downlink payloads
lib.shared-messages.statusDescription: The status of this gateway may be publicly displayed
lib.shared-messages.validateAddressForma: {field} must be in the format "host" or "host:port"
lib.shared-messages.validateApiKey: API keys must follow the format "NNSXS.[â€¦].[â€¦]"
lib.shared-messages.validateDelayFormat: {field} must be a positive, whole number
lib.shared-messages.validateDigit: {field} must have at least {digit} {digit, plural, one {digit} other {digits}}
lib.shared-messages.validateEmail: An email address must use exactly one "@", one "." and use no special characters
lib.shared-messages.validateFreqNumberic: All frequency values must be positive integers
lib.shared-messages.validateFreqRequired: All frequency values are required. Please remove empty entries.
lib.shared-messages.validateHexLength: {field} must be a complete hex value
lib.shared-messages.validateIdFormat: {field} must contain only lowercase letters, numbers and dashes (-)
lib.shared-messages.validateInt32: {field} must be a whole number, negative or positive
lib.shared-messages.validateLatitude: Latitude must be a whole or decimal number between -90 and 90
lib.shared-messages.validateLongitude: Longitude must be a whole or decimal number between -180 and 180
lib.shared-messages.validateMqttPassword: {field} must be empty or have at least 2 characters
lib.shared-messages.validateMqttUrl: MQTT URLs must have the format "mqtt[s]://[username][:password]@host.domain[:port]"
lib.shared-messages.validateNumberGte: {field} must be at least {min} or higher
lib.shared-messages.validateRights: At least one right must be selected
lib.shared-messages.validateSpecial: {field} must have at least {special} special {special, plural, one {character} other {characters}}
lib.shared-messages.validateUppercase: {field} must have at least {upper} uppercase {upper, plural, one {character} other {characters}}
lib.shared-messages.validateUrl: Must be a valid URL format, contain no spaces or special characters
lib.shared-messages.webhookAlreadyExists: A Webhook with the ID "{id}" already exists. Do you wish to replace this webhook?
